title.rendered: 15 Best Things To Do In Mexico City

content.rendered:
Whether you’re in town for a day or a week, there’s plenty of places to visit in Mexico City. Even if you’re searching for them or not, museums, activities, and attractions can be discovered at every turn. Also, you can’t cover everything in one trip, but Mexico City will be waiting for your return. Run your fingers over the spines of the books sprawled across downtown. Or, in La Condesa, treat yourself to a churro and a cup of hot chocolate in Parque México. So, let’s discover the best things to do in Mexico City!

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Mexico City

Exciting Outdoor Activities in Mexico City

1. Parque México

Parque México has been nicknamed “the city’s lungs” on several occasions. It’s one of the best places to visit in Mexico City for a fresh change of view. Moreover, the tree-lined, art deco-themed park is a great spot for a stroll and to watch break dancers and musicians.

Website

2. Floating Gardens of Xochimilco

One of the best things to do in Mexico City is driving 40 minutes south to see the Valley of Mexico. The vast lake and canal system is known as the World Heritage Site of Xochimilco. Additionally, it’s an extraordinary remnant of the area’s pre-Hispanic history.

Website

3. Teotihuacán

The ancient Mesoamerican pyramids of Teotihuacán once served as the largest city in the pre-Columbian Americas. If you have a few days, it’s one of the recommended best things to do in Mexico City. Also, don’t forget to bring sunscreen for this long day trip!

Know More

Related: 5 New York Hiking Trails to Add to Your Traveling Bucket-list

Don’t Miss Out On The Sports Scene in Mexico City

1. Estadio Azteca

Soccer is the sport that Mexicans are most passionate about. Club America plays in Mexico City’s Aztec Stadium or Estadio Azteca, which holds over 100,000 people. Moreover, it’s very often full to the rafters during matches.

Website

2. Hiking Nevado de Toluca Volcano, Toluca & Metepec Private Tour

During this private 13-hour tour, you’ll hike the dormant Nevado De Toluca Volcano and the beautiful twin lakes inside its crater. Certainly, one of the best things to do in Mexico City for a thrilling experience. Then, you’ll visit Toluca, a city that recounts the narrative of humans and nature’s dualism. Finally, the journey ends in Metepec, a charming “Magical Town.” It’s recognized for its vibrant architecture, views, and indigenous art created by expert potters.

Buy Tickets

3. Bike Tour: Coyoacan and Frida Kahlo Museum

Tour one of the most charming places to visit in Mexico City on bike through Coyoacan. Begin at Parque Mexico in stylish Condesa, then hop on your bike to Coyoacan. Further, ride through the cobblestone streets and learn about the life of legendary painter Frida Kahlo. Certainly, this is one of the best things to do in Mexico City for a holistic experience!

Buy Tickets

Related: 5 Ways To Save Money For Your Next Vacation

Must Visit Museums in Mexico City

1. Luis Barragán House and Studio

In Mexico City’s Hidalgo District, the old house and studio of Pritzker Prize-winning architect Luis Barragán has been converted into a museum. The artist’s clever use of color, light, shadow, shape, and texture is studied by architecture and design enthusiasts. If you’re trying to do all of the ‘best things to do in Mexico City’, you need to visit this place!

Website

2. Museo Soumaya

Arguably the most dazzling museum and among the best places to visit in the city is the Museo Soumaya. Its exterior is formed of more than 16,000 reflective hexagons, each twisting the building toward the sky.

Website

3. Museo Nacional de Antropología

This massive building in Chapultepec Park is among the city’s most famed places to visit in Mexico City. The huge structure, built by the late Mexican architect Pedro Ramrez Vázquez in 1964, nevertheless looks as avant-garde now as it did then. Furthermore, the museum has the biggest collection of ancient Mexican antiquities in the world.

Plan your visit

Related: How to Make Money for the Holidays – Pandemic Edition

Cultural Places To Visit in Mexico City

1. El Centro Histórico

The Centro Histórico, or Historic Center, of Mexico City is among the best places to visit in Mexico City. In fact, it has a mix of centuries-old structures, American-inspired skyscrapers, street markets, and countless museums!

Know More

2. Palacio Nacional

Learning about Mexico’s past is one of the best things to do in Mexico City! The History of Mexico, a renowned mural by Diego Rivera, depicts the Aztec era through the conquest and the Revolution. Additionally, it shows the country’s vast and intriguing rise of industry!

Know more

3. Bosque de Chapultepec

This enormous urban forest, spanning nearly 2.8 square miles, is unrivaled even by New York’s Central Park. The Castillo de Chapultepec is the only fortress in the Americas ever occupied by the European monarchy. Furthermore, with this, the Museo Nacional de Antropologa, and the Museo Tamayo Arte Contemporáneo, there are plenty of highlights to be found within the Bosque de Chapultepec.

Website

Related: The Eco-Life: How to Minimize Expenses While on Vacation

Explore Popular Bars, Shopping Centers & Restaurants in Mexico City

1. Barrio Alameda

The Barrio Alameda prides itself on being an “urban meeting point,” combining all the best things to do in this city. With art, drink, vintage fashion, and trendy restaurants in Mexico City, you can find everything under one roof!

Website

2. Galería Mexicana de Diseño

If you’re looking for places to visit in Mexico City for souvenirs, this gallery has a wide selection of authentic goods. Whether it’s an Acapulco chair or a monstera-leaf gold lamp, items can also be shipped for convenience!

Website

3. Comedor de los Milagros

This dining hall, situated in the vicinity of La Roma, takes you on a culinary journey around Latin America in just one meal. Order Colombian aborrajados, Argentinian chorizo, or Mexican volcanes, then wrap up with a fruity drink or agua fresca. Restaurants in Mexico City offer a wholesome meal!

Website

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find the best things to do in Mexico City? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we’ll help you find your perfect match!
